Print a list of launchable apps

Print a list of existing assocs, or create an assoc 
Usage: assoc "assoc name" "entire command" OR "appname" 

Example: 
assoc w whatsapp 


Deleting an assoc: assoc -rm "existing assoc name" 

Example: 
assoc -rm w
Toggle mobile data. Will always turn off it if WiFi is active

Print a list of available commands at this moment, or informations about a command 
Usage: help "command" 

Example: 
help search

Install an apk 
Usage: install "relative path to apk" 

Example 
install download/dropbox.apk
Play the next track in the queue
Play or pause the current track of the queue

Search anything in the default browser 
Usage: search "something" 

Example: 
search Android M

Share a file 
Usage: share "path to file" 

Example: 
share fool.img
Print informations about the current track

Uninstall an application 
Usage: uninstall "application name" OR "package name" 

Example: 
uninstall dropbox

Copy the selected file or directory in the chosen directory 
Usage: cp "path of file to copy" "path of output directory" 

Example: 
cp fool.txt /storage/sdcard1/docs
Print all the filenames in the current directory

Create a new directory in the current directory 
Usage: mkdir "new directory name" 

Example: 
mkdir NewFolder

Move the selected file or directory in the chosen directory 
Usage: mv "path of file to move" "path of output directory" 

Example: 
mv fool.jpg Photos

Open a file with the default application 
Usage: open "relative path" 

Example: 
open docs/fool.txt
Print the absolute path of the current directory

Delete the selected file or directory 
Usage: rm "path" 

Example: 
rm fool.txt
Apply changed settings and return to the launcher

Set the background, which can be an RGB color or your default wallpaper 
Usage: bgcolor "color (RGB)" OR "default" 

Example: 
bgcolor #004d40 

Another example: 
bgcolor default

Set the color of the printed device info 
Usage: devicecolor "color (RGB)" 

Example: 
devicecolor #1976d2

Set the color of the printed current directory 
Usage: dircolor "color (RGB)" 

Example: 
dircolor #ffc107

Set if you want the screen to be closed on double tap 
Usage: doubletap "true OR false" 

Example: 
doubletap true

Set the number of columns in the file view 
Usage: filecolumns "integer value" 

Example: 
filecolumns 2

Set the color of the printed file names in the current directory 
Usage: filescolor "color (RGB)" 

Example: 
dilescolor #e0e0e0

Decide if you want to show hidden files int the file view 
Usage: hiddenfiles "true OR false" 

Example: 
hiddenfiles false

Set the color of the user's input 
Usage: inputcolor "color (RGB)" 

Example: 
inputcolor #76ff03

Set the music folder 
Usage: musicfolder "path to folder" 

Example: 
musicfolder /storage/sdcard1/Music

Set the color of the printed output 
Usage: outputcolor "color (RGB)" 

Example: 
outputcolor #eeeeee

Set the color of the printed free RAM 
Usage: ramcolor "color (RGB)" 

Example: 
ramcolor #f44336

Set the startup directory 
Usage: startupdir absolute path 

Example: 
startupdir /storage/sdcard0/Download

string-array.name: launcher_tutorial
string-array.item: Hey, I\'m the developer. I\'ll tell you some things you should know about T-UI. This won\'t take more than 30-40 seconds, never fear! ;)
Use the command \"help\" to get a list of available commands\nIf you want to know something about a specific command, type \"help commandname\"

The command "assoc" lets you create an assoc, some characters that are converted in a command during the runtime 

For example: 
assoc d cd Downloads 

Now "d" will be considered as "cd Downloads" forever 
Use "help assoc" to get more info

The command \"config\" lets you to edit some T-UI\'s settings\nUsing this, you\'ll enter in the config mode, which contains some commands that aren\'t available in the main mode \nYou can use \"help\" to get them
The command \"apps\" retrieves a list of available apps on your device \nThe command\"call\" is a useful and fast way to call someone, using his name or his phone number

You can play your songs with a set of commands like \"play\", \"next\" and \"previous\", but you will have to set a music folder before. To do this, use the command \"musicfolder\", in the config mode \nTo randomize reproduction, use \"togglerandom\" (config mode).
The tutorial is over. You can find T-UI\'s features and commands on your own, now. Have a great use!
